summary: "Auld Lang Syne" is a popular Scottish song, often sung on New Year's Eve to say goodbye to the old year. The words were written by Robert Burns in 1788, based on an old folk song. It's also sung at special occasions like funerals and graduations. The title means "old long since," or simply, "long ago." The song reminds us to remember and appreciate the past.
title: Auld Lang Syne
